    • Method Detail

      • checkFileAccess

        public void checkFileAccess(java.lang.String fileName)
                     throws KKAdminException
        Check that we allow access to this location according to the permitted locations as specified in the konakartadmin.properties file
        Specified by:
        checkFileAccess in interface AdminFileMgrIf
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file to be accessed (read or written)
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if access to the filepath isn't permitted a Exception is thrown otherwise the method returns successfully.

      • checkFileAccess

        public void checkFileAccess(java.lang.String fileName,
                   java.util.Set<java.lang.String> _permittedLocations)
                     throws KKAdminException
        Check that we allow access to this location
        Specified by:
        checkFileAccess in interface AdminFileMgrIf
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file to be accessed (read or written)
        _permittedLocations - a set of Strings that are sub-strings of filepaths of permitted locations. A normalised filepath is permitted if it contains one of the permitted location substrings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if access to the filepath isn't permitted a Exception is thrown otherwise the method returns successfully.
        KKAdminException - if access to the filepath isn't permitted a KKAdminException is thrown otherwise the method returns successfully.

      • initImageIO

        protected void initImageIO()

      • addImage

        public void addImage(AdminImageOptions options)
              throws KKAdminException
        Description copied from interface: AdminFileMgrIf
        Add the image to the object defined in the AdminImageOptions object.

        When adding product images it uses the same conventions as used in the Admin Application and gets these definitions from the konakartadmin_gwt.properties file. Once an image is added to a product using this API the image will appear for the product in the Admin Application just as if it had been added via an image upload in the Admin application.

        Specified by:
        addImage in interface AdminFileMgrIf
        Parameters:
        options - The options that define which object the image should be added to
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - if the image was not added successfully

      • removeImage

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        options - The options that define which images should be removed
        Throws:
        KKAdminException - for any unexpected problems
